uid.description: The unique identifier (UID) of the payment gateway.

gateway_name.description: The unique name of the payment gateway initialized when the owning app was created, provided as the name parameter to the App Creation API.

supported_countries.description: A list of countries supported by the payment gateway, represented using ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country codes.

supported_currencies.description: A list of currencies supported by the payment gateway, represented using ISO 4217 format.

status.description: Indicates the current status of the payment gateway: 'active' (available for use), 'disabled' (not available for use), or 'deprecated' (still available but not recommended for new integrations)

payment_methods.description: The payment methods supported by the gateway.

credit_card.description: Indicates if the gateway supports credit card payments.

ach.description: Indicates if the gateway supports ACH payments.

ideal.description: Indicates if the gateway supports iDeal payments.

bancontact.description: Indicates if the gateway supports Bancontact payments.

twint.description: Indicates if the gateway supports Twint payments.

processing_features.description: The features the payment gateway supports and their current state (enabled/disabled).

multi_currency.description: Indicates if the gateway supports multi-currency transactions.

back_office_charge.description: Indicates if the gateway allows the SMB to process charges directly from the back office.

checkout.description: Indicates whether the payment gateway supports a checkout option initiated from the client portal. This value must always be set to true, as client portal checkout is a core feature.

refund.description: Indicates if the gateway supports full online refunds.

partial_refund.description: Indicates if the gateway supports partial online refunds. Requires full refunds to be enabled.

client_save_card_on_checkout.description: Indicates if clients can save cards on file during a payment flow.

client_save_card_standalone.description: Indicates if clients can save cards on file through a standalone flow.

save_card_by_business.description: Indicates if the gateway supports saving cards on file from the business side.

description: Client-facing payment gateway information with limited fields for security and privacy. This entity contains only the essential information needed by clients to understand available payment options.
